quotes.quote: Pride and vanity, the opposites of humility, can destroy our spiritual health as surely as a debilitating disease can destroy our physical health.
Diseased nature oftentimes breaks forth In strange eruptions.
Disease is the tax which the soul pays for the body, as the tenant pays house rent for the use of the house.
If we're going to fight a disease, let's fight one of the most terrible diseases of all, indifference.
The worst disease in the world is hate. And the cure for hate is love.
Diseases crucify the soul of man, attenuate our bodies, dry them, wither them, rivel them up like old apples, make them as so many Anatomies.
Arrogance, pedantry, and dogmatism...the occupational diseases of those who spend their lives directing the intellects of the young.
All interest in disease and death is only another expression of interest in life.
Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
There is no austerity equal to a balanced mind, and there is no happiness equal to contentment; there is no disease like covetousness, and no virtue like mercy.
Old age is not a disease - it is strength and survivorship, triumph over all kinds of vicissitudes and disappointments, trials and illnesses.
Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
Stand up to ignorance, because if you don't, the ignorant will run free to spread ignorance like a disease.
It is much more important to know what sort of a patient has a disease than what sort of a disease a patient has.
Idleness of the mind is much worse than that of the body: wit, without employment, is a disease - the rust of the soul, a plague, a hell itself.
Youth is a disease from which we all recover.
Bigotry is the disease of ignorance, of morbid minds; enthusiasm of the free and buoyant. education and free discussion are the antidotes of both.
Aggression unopposed becomes a contagious disease.
Diseases of the soul are more dangerous and more numerous than those of the body.
Mathematics is like childhood diseases. The younger you get it, the better.
We all labor against our own cure, for death is the cure of all diseases.
Great writers arrive among us like new diseases - threatening, powerful, impatient for patients to pick up their virus, irresistible.
One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.
When one gets in bed with government, one must expect the diseases it spreads.
Disease may be defined as 'A change produced in living things in consequence of which they are no longer in harmony with their environment.
Everything on the Earth has a purpose, every disease an herb to cure it, and every person a mission. This is the Indian theory of existence.
Gossip is a disease spread from mouth to mouth.
Everything in food works together to create health or disease.
